meanings.definition: To play or move clumsily or ineptly.
meanings.sent1: She was foozling with the ball during the game.
meanings.sent2: He always foozles when trying to catch a frisbee.
meanings.sent3: While foozling with the puzzle pieces, she accidentally dropped one.
meanings.sent4: The toddler foozled around the room, knocking over toys.
meanings.sent5: The dancer foozled across the stage, tripping over her own feet.

meanings.definition: To handle or manipulate something awkwardly or unskillfully.
meanings.sent1: He was foozling with the remote control, trying to change the channel.
meanings.sent2: She foozled with the jar lid, unable to open it.
meanings.sent3: The chef foozled with the knife, almost cutting his finger.
meanings.sent4: The mechanic foozled with the engine, causing more damage.
meanings.sent5: The student foozled with the calculator, entering the wrong numbers.

meanings.definition: A clumsy or inept action or movement.
meanings.sent1: Her foozling of the dance routine made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent2: The comedian's foozling of the joke's punchline fell flat.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's foozling with the leash tangled him up in knots.
meanings.sent4: The actor's foozling on stage added a touch of humor to the play.
meanings.sent5: The child's foozling with the crayons resulted in a colorful mess.
